words.example: The importance of sth. is clear to everyone.
It is important to do sth.
For example, we can save energy.
The system is controlled by a computer.
He feels nervous before a speech.
They invited sb. to the party.
The teacher requires sb. to do sth.
Many people volunteer to help others.
He takes a bath every day.
It is hard to breathe here.
He is at the top of the list.
The program offers double reading time.

phrases.meaning: 把某物给某人（实际给到）
phrases.example: The teacher gives a book to sb.
The weather is getting worse day by day.
Remember to turn off the light.
When we leave home, we should turn off the light.
When we go out, we can walk or ride a bike.
For example, we can plant trees.
She talked with sb. after class.
The teacher talked to sb.
They talked about the plan.
She asked sb. to close the door.
He asked sb. for help.
She will give a speech tomorrow.
They share ideas on a website.
He is learning a foreign language.
We did an experiment in science class.
Please keep quiet in class.
We plan to finish the work today.
She left without telling anyone.
Please write down the answer.
The school is on the top of the list.
She volunteers to help others.
They spend time studying English.
Children grow up fast.

phrases.phrase: spend the whole summer doing sth.
phrases.example: He spent the whole summer working on a farm.
The mountains have fresh air.
They build low-cost houses.

phrases.phrase: teach sb. how to do sth.
phrases.example: She teaches children how to read.
She has trouble understanding English.
Some children have trouble in reading.
Reading books makes people better.

patterns.example: The environment becomes more and more important.

patterns.pattern: It is + adj. + for sb. to do sth.
patterns.meaning: 对某人来说做某事是……的
patterns.example: It is important for us to protect the environment.

grammar.title: 动名词作主语
grammar.definition: 当动词以动名词形式出现并在句中表示“一件事、一个行为”时，可以整体充当主语，通常表示抽象、概括性的动作或行为。此时整个动名词短语被视为一件事情，在语法上相当于名词。
grammar.structure: doing sth. + 谓语
usage: 表示一种行为或习惯：Protecting sth. is important.
表示抽象概念或活动：Saving energy helps the environment.
用于表达一般性事实或观点：Planting trees improves the air.

mistakes.explanation: 作主语时，动词需要变为动名词形式。

examples: Protecting the environment is necessary.
Saving energy is a good habit.
Planting trees makes the air cleaner.

grammar.title: 第三人称单数的一般现在时
grammar.definition: 在一般现在时中，当主语是第三人称单数（如 he / she / it 或表示“一件事”的主语）时，谓语动词需要根据规则加 -s 或 -es，用来表示习惯、事实或普遍真理。
grammar.structure: 第三人称单数主语 + 动词-s/es
usage: 描述客观事实：The environment becomes worse.
描述习惯性行为：He turns off the light.
描述普遍观点：Protecting sth. matters a lot.

mistakes.explanation: 第三人称单数主语后，谓语动词要加 -s。

examples: It becomes more and more serious.
She saves energy every day.
Protecting nature helps everyone.

grammar.title: more and more 结构
grammar.definition: “more and more + 形容词”用于表示程度的不断加深或变化，强调事物随着时间推移发生的渐进变化，常用于描述趋势。
grammar.structure: more and more + adj.
usage: 描述变化趋势：The weather is getting more and more terrible.
描述重要性增强：It becomes more and more important.
描述程度递增：Life is more and more convenient.

mistakes.wrong: It is more important and more important.
mistakes.correct: It is more and more important.
mistakes.explanation: 固定结构应使用 more and more。

examples: The environment is becoming more and more important.
Cities are getting more and more crowded.

grammar.title: 并列句与连接词
grammar.definition: 英语中如果出现两个完整的句子，不能仅用逗号连接，而需要使用并列连词（如 and, but, so）或其他连接手段，使句子结构完整、逻辑清楚。
grammar.structure: 句子 A + 并列连词 + 句子 B
usage: 表示顺承关系：We protect the environment, and we make life better.
表示因果关系：The environment is polluted, so we should act now.
避免逗号连接两个完整句子。

mistakes.wrong: We protect the environment, it makes our life better.
mistakes.correct: We protect the environment, and it makes our life better.
mistakes.explanation: 两个完整句子之间需要连接词。

examples: We save energy, and we reduce pollution.
We plant trees, and the air becomes cleaner.

grammar.title: tell / talk / speak 的用法区别
grammar.definition: tell、talk、speak 都与“说”有关，但用法不同。tell 强调“告诉”，通常涉及信息的传递；talk 强调双方交流；speak 更偏向正式表达或能力。
grammar.structure: tell sb. sth. / tell sb. to do sth.; talk to/with sb.; speak to sb.
usage: speak：多用于正式场合或语言能力

mistakes.correct: He told me to do sth.
mistakes.explanation: tell 后不能直接接 doing 形式。

examples: The teacher tells sb. to do sth.
They talk with sb. about sth.
She speaks to the class clearly.

grammar.title: tell / say / speak / talk 的区别
grammar.definition: 这四个动词都与“说”有关，但侧重点不同。tell 强调把信息告诉别人，常接双宾语或 to do；say 强调说的内容；speak 强调说话方式或语言；talk 强调双方交流。
grammar.structure: tell sb. sth. / tell sb. to do sth.; say sth.; speak + language; talk to/with sb.

mistakes.correct: He told me to do sth.
mistakes.explanation: tell 后不能直接接 doing。

examples: She tells sb. the truth.
He said it was easy.
They talk with sb. about work.

grammar.title: 一般过去时
grammar.definition: 一般过去时用于描述过去某个时间发生的动作或存在的状态，通常与 yesterday、last night 等时间状语连用。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 动词过去式

mistakes.explanation: 过去时间要使用动词过去式。

examples: I did my homework yesterday.
She spoke at the meeting.

grammar.title: 现在完成时
grammar.definition: 现在完成时用于表示过去发生但对现在有影响的动作，或从过去持续到现在的经历或状态。
grammar.structure: have/has + 过去分词
usage: 表示结果对现在的影响

mistakes.explanation: 现在完成时要使用过去分词。

examples: I have done my homework.
She has spoken to the teacher.

grammar.title: 被动语态
grammar.definition: 被动语态用于强调动作的承受者，而不是动作的执行者，常用于不知道或不必说明动作发出者的情况。
grammar.structure: be + 过去分词

mistakes.correct: The apple was eaten by me.
mistakes.explanation: 被动语态需要 be + 过去分词。

examples: The house is controlled by a system.
The apple was eaten by sb.

grammar.title: 过去分词的三种用法
grammar.definition: 过去分词既可以与完成时连用，也可以构成被动语态，还可以单独作形容词修饰名词。
grammar.structure: have + 过去分词 / be + 过去分词 / 过去分词 + 名词

mistakes.explanation: 此处 eaten 作形容词，结构是正确的。

examples: I have finished the work.
The room is cleaned.
The eaten apple is on the table.

grammar.title: It is + adj. + to do sth.
grammar.definition: 该结构用于对某个行为作出评价，真正的动作由不定式短语表达，常用于说明“做某事是怎样的”。
grammar.structure: It is + adj. + to do sth.
usage: 评价行为的重要性：It is essential to prepare well.
说明难易程度：It is easy to do sth.
表达感受或态度：It is surprising to see sth.

mistakes.correct: It is essential to prepare well.
mistakes.explanation: 该结构中必须使用 to do 形式。

examples: It is important to study hard.
It is surprising to see the result.

grammar.title: 介词后接名词或动名词
grammar.definition: 介词后面不能直接接动词原形，通常接名词；当表示动作含义时，需使用动名词形式。
grammar.structure: 介词 + 名词 / doing
usage: without 后表示缺少某种行为：without doing sth.
in / on / for 后接名词：in class, on a website

mistakes.explanation: 介词后不能接动词原形。

examples: He left without saying goodbye.
They talked about protecting the environment.

grammar.title: 动名词作主语（整体概念）
grammar.definition: 当一个动作被整体看作“一件事”时，可使用动名词短语作主语，表达抽象或概括性的行为。
grammar.structure: doing sth. + 谓语
usage: 表达普遍观点：Preparing well is essential.
描述一般事实：Doing experiments is interesting.

mistakes.explanation: 作主语时应使用动名词形式。

examples: Preparing well is essential for success.
Doing experiments helps learning.

grammar.title: see sb. do sth. 与 see sb. doing sth.
grammar.definition: see sb. do sth. 强调整个动作过程；see sb. doing sth. 强调动作正在进行。
grammar.structure: see sb. do sth. / see sb. doing sth.
usage: 看到完整过程：see sb. do sth.
看到正在发生的动作：see sb. doing sth.

mistakes.wrong: I saw him to speak English.
mistakes.explanation: see 后不用 to do。

examples: I saw him enter the room.
I saw her speaking English.

grammar.title: invite sb. to do sth.
grammar.definition: invite 表示邀请，后接不定式，说明邀请对方去做的事情。
grammar.structure: invite sb. to do sth.

mistakes.correct: They invited him to do sth.
mistakes.explanation: invite 后只能接 to do。

examples: She invited sb. to join the team.
They invited sb. to have dinner.

grammar.title: 不定式 to do 的正确用法
grammar.definition: 不定式 to do 用于表示目的、计划或将要发生的动作，是动词的非谓语形式之一，不能使用 to doing。
grammar.structure: to + 动词原形
usage: 表示计划或打算：plan to do sth.
用于某些动词之后：want / decide / ask to do sth.

mistakes.explanation: to 后必须接动词原形。

examples: She hopes to win.
We decided to leave early.

grammar.title: 一般疑问句的构成（无助动词时）
grammar.definition: 当陈述句中没有 be 动词或助动词时，变一般疑问句需要借助 do / does / did 放在句首，原句动词还原为原形。
grammar.structure: Do/Does/Did + 主语 + 动词原形

mistakes.explanation: 疑问句中动词需还原为原形。

examples: Do you like apples?
Did she finish the work?

grammar.title: 第三人称单数
grammar.definition: 第三人称单数指 he / she / it 或单个的人或物，在一般现在时中，其谓语动词需加 -s 或 -es。
grammar.structure: 第三人称单数主语 + 动词-s/es
usage: 描述习惯：He gets up early.

mistakes.explanation: 第三人称单数主语后动词要加 s。

examples: She likes music.
The oven works well.

grammar.title: 宾语从句
grammar.definition: 宾语从句是在句中作宾语的从句，整体相当于一个名词，用来说明“是什么、做什么”等内容。
grammar.structure: 主句 + 引导词 + 从句

mistakes.wrong: I don’t know what does he want.
mistakes.correct: I don’t know what he wants.
mistakes.explanation: 宾语从句中语序要用陈述语序。

examples: I know what he wants.
She asked what we needed.

grammar.title: 画线部分提问的方法
grammar.definition: 对画线部分提问时，需要先判断画线内容的性质，选用合适的疑问词，再将其余部分改为一般疑问句语序。
grammar.structure: 疑问词 + 一般疑问句

mistakes.explanation: 疑问句需要借助助动词 did。

examples: What did he buy?
Where do you live?

grammar.title: 一般疑问句的构成（无 be / 助动词）
grammar.definition: 当陈述句中没有 be 动词或助动词时，变一般疑问句需要借助 do / does / did 放在句首，原句中的实义动词还原为原形。
grammar.structure: Do / Does / Did + 主语 + 动词原形
usage: 一般现在时用 do / does

mistakes.explanation: 疑问句中动词要还原为原形。

examples: Do they like sports?
Did she finish her work?

grammar.title: without 合并句子
grammar.definition: 使用介词 without 合并句子时，需要将其中一个句子转化为名词性结构，通常用动名词形式，且省略主语。
grammar.structure: 主句 + without doing sth.
usage: 表示在没有某种行为的情况下
合并两个有相同主语的句子

mistakes.wrong: They cook meals without waste food.
mistakes.correct: They cook meals without wasting food.
mistakes.explanation: without 后要用动名词形式。

examples: He left without saying anything.
They work without wasting time.

grammar.title: 并列句中省略主语
grammar.definition: 当两个分句的主语相同时，后一个分句中的主语可以省略，以避免重复。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 动词 … and + 动词 …
usage: 常用于 and / but 连接的并列句

mistakes.wrong: She likes apples and she likes oranges.
mistakes.correct: She likes apples and likes oranges.
mistakes.explanation: 两个分句主语相同，后一个可省略。

examples: He went home and finished his homework.
She opened the door and walked in.

grammar.title: 名词与动词的拼写区分（-e）
grammar.definition: 英语中部分名词与对应动词在拼写上通过是否加 -e 来区分，且读音也会发生变化。
grammar.structure: 名词（无 e） / 动词（加 e）

mistakes.explanation: breath 是名词，breathe 是动词。

examples: Take a deep breath.
Please breathe slowly.

grammar.title: 阅读理解中的信息交叉定位
grammar.definition: 在阅读理解中，当题干包含两个或以上关键信息时，需要在文章中分别定位这些信息，并找到它们交叉出现的段落或句子，答案通常就在该交叉位置附近。
grammar.structure: 关键词 A + 关键词 B → 交叉定位
usage: 人物 + 行为：young people + volunteer
地点 + 行为：USA + help others

mistakes.wrong: 只找到人物就直接选答案
mistakes.correct: 同时确认人物和时间/行为等信息
mistakes.explanation: 单一信息不足以锁定正确答案。

examples: Find Alice and summer in the same paragraph.
Look for young people and volunteer together.

grammar.title: 后置定语
grammar.definition: 当修饰名词的成分较长或为短语、从句时，通常放在名词后面，起到限定和说明名词的作用，这种修饰方式称为后置定语。
grammar.structure: 名词 + 修饰成分
usage: 介词短语作后置定语：the apple on the tree
从句作后置定语：families that are not rich

mistakes.explanation: 较复杂的修饰成分需后置。

examples: The house near the river is old.
Families that need help live here.

grammar.title: 定语从句
grammar.definition: 定语从句是用来修饰名词的从句，通常放在被修饰的名词后面，由关系词引导，用来说明名词的特征或身份。
grammar.structure: 名词 + 关系词 + 从句

mistakes.wrong: Families are not rich live here.
mistakes.correct: Families that are not rich live here.
mistakes.explanation: 需要用关系词连接从句。

examples: People who help others are kind.
Houses that are low-cost sell well.

grammar.title: 双宾语结构
grammar.definition: 有些动词可以同时带两个宾语，一个表示人，一个表示事物，通常表示“给某人某物”或“教某人某事”。
grammar.structure: 动词 + 间接宾语 + 直接宾语

mistakes.wrong: He teaches how to build houses people.
mistakes.correct: He teaches people how to build houses.
mistakes.explanation: 间接宾语通常放在直接宾语之前。

examples: She gives sb. advice.
He teaches children skills.

grammar.title: 定语从句（后置定语）
grammar.definition: 当一个从句用来修饰名词，并放在名词后面时，称为定语从句。定语从句整体相当于形容词，用来限定或说明名词的特征。
grammar.structure: 名词 + 关系词 + 从句

mistakes.wrong: Children have trouble in reading need help.
mistakes.correct: Children who have trouble in reading need help.
mistakes.explanation: 修饰名词时需要用关系词引导从句。

examples: Children who like reading learn faster.
The students that need help are here.

grammar.title: 后置定语与最近修饰原则
grammar.definition: 英语中较长的修饰成分通常放在名词后面，且默认修饰距离最近的名词，这称为最近修饰原则。
grammar.structure: 名词 + 修饰成分
usage: 常见于短语或从句作定语

mistakes.explanation: 修饰关系需清晰，避免歧义。

examples: The apple on the table is mine.
Children with trouble need help.

grammar.title: 第三人称单数与主谓一致
grammar.definition: 当主语为第三人称单数或表示“一件事”时，谓语动词在一般现在时中需使用第三人称单数形式。
grammar.structure: 第三人称单数主语 + 动词-s/es

mistakes.explanation: 动名词作主语视为单数。

examples: Reading helps children.
Learning English takes time.

grammar.title: 翻译中的顺译与逆译
grammar.definition: 简单句通常顺译；当句子中包含介词、连词或较长修饰成分时，常需要从后往前翻译，以保证语义清晰。
grammar.structure: 先处理修饰成分，再翻译主干

mistakes.wrong: 逐词直译导致语义混乱
mistakes.explanation: 翻译应以语义清楚为原则。

examples: Children with trouble in reading need help.
Books that are useful help students.
